Meet the Brothers

7:00 PM@ Student Union - Room 301

An informal introduction to Alpha Zeta. Come meet our members, learn about our values, and discover what makes our brotherhood unique.

January 18, 2026

Coffee Chats

Various Times@ Campus Coffee Shops

One-on-one conversations with current members. Sign up for a time slot to learn more about specific career paths and member experiences.

January 20, 2026

Professional Workshop

6:30 PM@ Marshall School of Business - Room 205

An interactive workshop covering resume building, interview skills, and networking strategies. See firsthand how AZ prepares members for professional success.

January 22, 2026

Case Competition Night

7:00 PM@ JKP Building - Room 110

Experience our signature AZ Groups format! Work alongside current members to solve a real business case and showcase your analytical skills.

January 24, 2026

Social Night

8:00 PM@ TBD

A casual evening to connect with members in a relaxed setting. Get to know the people behind the fraternity and see our brotherhood in action.

January 26, 2026

Final Round Interviews

By Appointment@ Various Locations

Invitation-only interviews for candidates who have demonstrated exceptional fit throughout the rush process.

January 28, 2026

Bid Night

6:00 PM@ TBD

The culmination of rush! Selected candidates will receive their official invitations to join the Alpha Zeta family.

Member Stories

Hear from brothers about their Alpha Zeta experience

“AZ has been the most essential aspect of my college career. Every great memory, from the day I joined to the day I graduated from USC, has stemmed from AZ—from the professional development to the beautiful experiences shared with my AZ brothers.”

Riley Yen

Alumnus '23 • KPMG Consulting

“The mentorship, networking opportunities, and guidance AZ offers prepared me with the professional skills to make the most of my internship this past summer. The brothers here truly want to see you succeed.”

Kirsten Kim

Junior • Incoming SpaceX Intern

“What sets AZ apart is the genuine care members have for each other. The connections I made aren't just professional contacts—they're lifelong friends who were there for me through every challenge.”

Kevin Huang

Alumnus '22 • Goldman Sachs

“Joining AZ was the best decision I made at USC. The structure of AZ Groups, combined with the support of my brothers, gave me the confidence to pursue opportunities I never thought possible.”

Rachel Santos

Alumna '24 • McKinsey & Company

Frequently Asked Questions

Everything you need to know about joining Alpha Zeta

Alpha Zeta is open to all USC students regardless of major, year, or background. We welcome freshmen through seniors who are passionate about professional development and building meaningful connections.
Members typically commit 4-6 hours per week, including weekly general meetings, AZ Group sessions, and social events. We understand academic priorities and work to accommodate busy schedules.
AZ Groups are small teams of 4-6 members led by upperclassmen that meet weekly for professional development, case study practice, interview prep, and mentorship. It's the core of the AZ experience.
Rush spans about two weeks and includes informational events, coffee chats, workshops, and interviews. It's designed to be a mutual evaluation process where both you and AZ can determine if we're a good fit for each other.
While we don't have a strict GPA cutoff, we look for candidates who demonstrate academic commitment alongside their other pursuits. We evaluate candidates holistically based on character, potential, and fit.
AZ focuses on genuine brotherhood first. While we offer exceptional professional development through AZ Groups, our emphasis on meaningful relationships and community service sets us apart. Our alumni network is close-knit and actively engaged.
Our members pursue diverse paths including consulting, investment banking, tech, marketing, entrepreneurship, and more. Our alumni work at companies like Goldman Sachs, McKinsey, Google, and various startups.
Yes, there are semesterly dues that cover operational costs, events, and professional development resources. We offer payment plans and financial assistance to ensure AZ is accessible to all qualified candidates.
